ISSUE.TITLE: Error in fetching TimeSeries URL from sub-property in task `data` object
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Time series editor fails when the `value` field is set to a sub-property of the task's `data` object. **To Reproduce** For example: 1. Create a labelling project 2. Add a label config with time series, e.g.: ```xml <View> <TimeSeriesLabels name="event-label" toName="ts" maxUsages="1"> <Label value="event"/> </TimeSeriesLabels> <TimeSeries name="ts" valueType="url" value="$files.csv" timeColumn="A"> <Channel column="B"/> </TimeSeries> </View> ``` 3. Upload CSV file to data source (e.g. local file). Sample that works with the above config: ```csv A,B 1,2 2,6 3,10 4,15 ``` 4. Add some tasks, e.g. ```json [ { "data": { "files": { "csv": "/data/local-files/?d=local-files/test.csv" } } } ] ``` 5. Open task from project view. 6. Get error: "Cannot find url in **files.csv** field of your task" **Expected behavior** The time series is displayed without error. **Fix** Use lodash to parse the `value` field via the `parseValue` function in `web/libs/editor/src/utils/data.js` https://github.com/HumanSignal/label-studio/pull/5611
